alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 07 at 7:06AM MDT until May 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND... .West to southwest flow strengthens today and again on Sunday as a surface low develops along the Front Range of the Southern Rockies. Windy conditions will be combined with dangerously low humidity and very dry fuel conditions tomorrow afternoon. Min RH dipping below 8% is expected this afternoon and evening, followed by very poor overnight recoveries. Similar RH and stronger winds are very likely on Sunday, which keeps critical fire danger conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 110, 111, 112, AND 113... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 110, 111, 112, AND 113... * AFFECTED AREA... Southwest and South-Central New Mexico and Far West Texas. * WIND...20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Stronger winds with gusts to 50 mph on Sunday. * HUMIDITY...3 to 8% * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
